content.description: SDS on Cedar Right and begin moving left on Calamine Lotion but at the tree head straight up to a NO FALL ZONE. Top out above the horizontal tree and stacked stones. Committing.
SDS on a flat block. Put your feet on and fire to the crimp at the lip and top out.
content.location: SDS on the right side of small cave.

content.description: SDS on Stumpy. Hit the lip and move left across slopers to a crimp and top out above Flux Pavilion Project. Good and solid.
content.location: SDS start on the right side of small cave.

content.description: 6 feet right of Cedar Right. Grab a left hand 3finger pinch and a slopey crescent hold. Put feet on and fire up and right to the lip. Hand jam and top out. Classic.
content.location: Stand Start 6ft right of Cedar Right

content.description: SDS to Sound the Alarm. SDS on Cedar Right. Move right on independent holds of Cedar Right into start of Sound the Alarm. Harder intro. Harder Establishing and tougher dyno.
Cool feature and decent climbing. Wanna-be version of Old English.

SDS on jug. Traverse right to a sloper and then to flat ledge. Fire to the Arete and topout straight up. It is possible to roll around the arete and topout on the rightside but the rock is very rotten and holds will probably break.
SDS on The Nonathan and traverse right into Tree Of Life. Spotters advised.
Traverse. Left to right. Adds a little more endurance to Cedar Right.

Starts on the left overhang of the Flu Pavilion boulder (prow)  just left of the two trees. Steep moves to a cool openhanded side pull finish over some scary rocks. Cool movement if this problem is scrubbed up but low quality rock.
Start on crimps and obvious feet. bump to smaller crimp and lunge to top.
Seems doable if you are a beastmaster. SDS in the cave. Power out on Crimps to a side pull, a bloc?, the lip? and take it into Blistering Ivy for the finale? May or may not go.
content.location: Sds in the back of small cave

content.description: Decent movement and warmup. SDS in the slot and roll around the corner left and topout up the slab.
Piss hard move into Blistering Ivy finish. Breakdown by the numbers is ~V7 move into ~12 moves of solid 6/7. Hard 8...easy 9...?Heber Springs Test Piece.
content.location: Start on Carnival of Thrust and finish on Blistering on Ivy.

content.description: Classic for the area. Rock quality is sandy down low but this boulder problem has a really unique topout and becomes the finish for many of the problems on the Flux Pavilion.SDS on pockets for both hands. Fire to the flat bloc. Up to a sloper and a sloper pinch, big move to the lip and top out straight up on small sloper crimpers. Top out is the crux. Bailing right makes this V2.
Grab a high left hand sloper and a 1/8pad right hand crimp. Paste a foot and pull on. Stabilize. Then huck for the right hand crimper pinch. Roll over and top out.
content.location: Same Start as Cold Fusion Bred. Starts on crimps just left of small "Flux Pavilion" cave

content.description: SDS on Cedar Right and traverse left on crimps into start of The Nonathan. Finish on The Nonathan. Adds a little bit more pump to The Nonathan.
Mossy Bluff and Northeast Arkansas Sloper Test Piece.The Full traverse of Flux Pavilion. Starts on Stumpy and goes all the way left to Cedar Right finish. ~23 moves... give or take.
content.location: Begins on the rightside of small cave. Same start as "Stumpy"

content.description: Start on the west side of the overhanging point on The Flux Pavillion Boulder. (10' left of The Nonathan)Start on juggy seam. Head staight up to top out staying left of the sloper on the lip of the overhang. Trash rock but some really cool movement.

Lone boulder within eye-sight on the River Access Road. High concentration of entertaining powerful boulder problems. Downside is that the rock is soft, friable, and lower footholds are often sandy.This being said there is an incredible circuit of nearly 40+ boulder problems from V0 up to V10+ all within a stones throw - if you are willing to go in with an open mind and look for a good workout and not good rock. Great for a Heber Springs local or anyone visiting Greers Ferry but this will never be a destination crag. All stars are relative for the area and not to be confused with far better classics on much better stone found nearly everywhere else in Arkansas. This is a high concentration local circuit area and a great place to dial boulder problems and then gain fitness by completing longer endurance linkups.
